summary: The document comprises memorandums and forms concerning the request for military and domestic cover for Mr. Ross Lester Crozier, a CIA career agent, under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It outlines the operational and security necessities for securing cover, including the relocation of Mr. Crozier from the DODS area and the provision of appropriate office or apartment space. Additionally, it details the reassignment of Career Agent Harold Noryays from JHAAVE to Washington on 21 January 1963.
key_findings: Request for military cover for Mr. Ross Lester Crozier to meet operational and security needs.
Relocation of Mr. Crozier from the DODS area with provision of suitable office or apartment space.
Need for domestic cover for Mr. Crozier for credit and employment purposes.
Inclusion or change of Mr. Crozier's status on the Domestic Cover List for military cover (Army).
Reassignment of Career Agent Harold Noryays from JHAAVE to Washington on 21 January 1963.
